ARABIC: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِىَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He inspected the birds and said, 'How is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is it absent without leave?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When he reviewed the Tair, he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (On another occasion) Solomon inspected the birds and said: "Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Is he among the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Solomon) inspected the birds and said, "How is it that I cannot see the hoopoe. Is he absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And he surveyed the birds – he therefore said, “What is to me that I do not see the Hudhud (hoopoe), or is he really absent?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He inspected the birds, and said: "What is the matter that I see not the hoopoe Or is he among the absentees"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And he reviewed the birds, then said: How is it I see not the hoopoe or is it that he is of the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And he reviewed the birds; then he said, 'How is it with me, that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not the hoopoe, or is he among the absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then Solomon inspected the birds, and said, "How is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Is he absent then?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he sought after the birds and said: what aileth me that I see not the hoopoe; is he among the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [One day] he reviewed the birds, and said, ‘Why do I not see the hoopoe? Or is he absent?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He inspected the birds, and said: "What is the matter that I see not the hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He reviewed the birds and said: 'Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe here? Or is he among the absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then he inspected the birds, and said, “Why do I not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:20] And he reviewed the birds, to see the hoopoe — which would locate water beneath the ground and indicate its location by pecking at it, whereupon the devils would extract it, for Solomon required it for when he prayed; but he could not see him — then he said, ‘Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe?, in other words, is there something preventing me from seeing him? Or is he among the absent?, and so I cannot see him   because he is absent?’ And when he became certain [of the hoopoe’s absence],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he sought among the birds) he inspected the birds (and said) when he could not see the hoopoe among them: (How is it that I see not the hoopoe) in his place, (or is he among the absent?)
